skill.name: domain-expertise-template
skill.description: Template for creating domain expertise skills. Copy and customize for your specific domain.
skill.summary: Template for creating domain expertise skills. Copy and customize for your specific domain.
skill.author: ChaiWithJai

security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown template file with no executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond its own location. No security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Building domain expertise skills from scratch is challenging without a clear structure. This template provides a ready-made framework with principles, processes, and output templates so you can focus on your domain knowledge instead of format.
actual_capabilities: Provides a structured framework for documenting domain expertise
Includes sections for core principles with examples
Defines step-by-step processes with inputs and outputs
Offers output templates for consistent deliverables
Includes intake questions to gather relevant context
limitations: This is a template, not a ready-to-use skill for any specific domain
Requires manual customization with domain-specific content
Does not include any pre-built expertise for any domain
Users must test and iterate to ensure effectiveness

use_cases.title: Document Specialized Knowledge
use_cases.description: Capture and share your domain expertise in a structured format that others can follow.

use_cases.title: Create Skill Frameworks
use_cases.description: Build reusable templates for consistent skill documentation across your organization.

use_cases.title: Develop Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills tailored to specific industries or methodologies.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new domain expertise skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the domain-expertise-template to create a skill for [your domain]. Include 3 core principles, a 3-step process, and at least one output template.

prompt_templates.title: Add Principles
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me define 3 core principles for my [domain] skill. For each principle, provide a clear explanation and good/bad examples.

prompt_templates.title: Define Process Steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 3-step process for my [domain] skill using the template format. Include purpose, actions, and expected output for each step.

prompt_templates.title: Build Output Templates
prompt_templates.prompt: Write output templates for my [domain] skill. Include a markdown template with clear section headers and guidance for what to include in each section.

output_examples.input: Use the domain-expertise-template to create a coding review skill
output: Core Principle 1: START WITH UNDERSTANDING - Before reviewing code, confirm the requirements and context. Good: Asking about the feature's purpose first. Bad: Jumping straight to line-by-line critique.

Core Principle 2: BALANCE CRITIQUE WITH SOLUTIONS - Every problem identified should include a suggested fix. Good: 'This loop is O(nÂ²); consider using a hash map for O(n).' Bad: 'This is inefficient.'
Core Principle 3: SEPARATE STYLE FROM SUBSTANCE - Distinguish between preferences and actual issues. Good: Noting the convention mismatch. Bad: Demanding fixes to personal style preferences.

best_practices: Replace all placeholders with specific, actionable content for your domain
Include real examples that demonstrate both good and bad approaches
Test the skill with actual use cases before publishing
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholder text like [PLACEHOLDER] in the final skill
Creating generic principles that apply to any domain
Skipping the testing phase and publishing an untuned skill

faq.question: What tools support this skill template?
faq.answer: This template works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool interprets the structured sections and generates domain-specific outputs.

faq.question: How long does it take to customize a skill?
faq.answer: Basic customization takes 30-60 minutes. Adding detailed examples and testing may require 2-4 hours depending on domain complexity.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other skill templates?
faq.answer: Yes. You can reference or import sections from other skills. The template is designed to be modular and extensible.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this template?
faq.answer: This is a read-only template file. It does not access files, networks, or system resources. Your customization stays local.

faq.question: Why is my generated skill not triggering?
faq.answer: Check that the skill name and trigger conditions in the header are specific. Avoid generic names that match too many user requests.

faq.question: How is this different from a system prompt?
faq.answer: This template structures expertise into reusable sections. System prompts are single files. The template format makes complex expertise easier to maintain and extend.
